data.title: Peaceful among the trees with a view of the water
data.text: We take our chairs and sit under the trees while watching paddle boarders and beach goers. Tends to be more secluded and quiet before the summer season.

data.title: Great on so many levels!
data.text: The Buttonwoods City Park, otherwise known as the Warwick City Park is great! There are trails to walk, jog, bike or walk your dog. In addition to these great trails (3 miles round), they have a big and small dog park (completely fenced in), a ball field, basketball courts, soccer field, even a field hockey rink. To top this city park off, is the Buttonwoods beach. Small, but nice for not having to drive far. Picnic benches too. Free to public!

data.title: A hidden gem
data.text: Nice place to take a swim, have a cookout or just to relax. Don't plan on jumping in the waves as there aren't any.

data.title: better than most of Warwick City parks
data.text: It is one of the few parks that the city rake, clean up and maintain. It does not contaminate with bacteria as often as the rest.

data.title: Childhood Beach
data.text: This was my late mother's favorite beach, and she took me here when I was a child and a teenager.  I loved it - especially when everything was "clean."

data.title: Nice local park with a variety of options
data.text: Clean local park with a variety of options for fun...3 mile walking/riding path through beautiful wooded area with water on one side. Has a Dog park that is pretty good if your one to take your dog to a dog park and a beach area that has some of the prettiest scenery! Plenty of open fields to picnic, play games, fly kites as well as designated baseball/softball and soccer fields as well as a street hockey court and a skate park. The beach area is NOT and I repeat, NOT good for swimming! The water is regularly closed due to high bacteria rates, but this is the bay not the open ocean and is surrounded by homes so it is the inevitable, but they beach its self is a nice place to walk, sit and relax and enjoy the scenery!

data.title: Great loose dog park.
data.text: Great spot to let your dog play with others.  There are two areas for the dogs, small dog and large dog.  But there is no shade in the small dog area, where there is in the large dog area.  But there are lawn chairs on both sides to sit on and lots og fun people to chat with.

data.title: my thoughts
data.text: just nice park for picnic walking your dog..jump into pond for dip ..not all beach access are swimming areas..nice trail..just nice day out..good view to kill a day while on vacation

data.title: sketchy
data.text: so disappointed when we finally got a free afternoon to go to the local beach - it was shady and sketchy and the people in the neighborhood didn't make it feel safe.

data.title: Watched my grandson splash in salt water for the first time
data.text: It was a visit from Texas relatives whom I really didn't know where to take them as they have a 2 yr old son.   Chose this park and this Warwick beach and the parents and I actually had tears watching a land locked Texas boy rolling in the sand and the shallow salty water.   They're coming back next year for more.

data.title: nice beach plus plenty to do
data.text: This is a nice beach - perfect for families. There is a dog park and trails that meander around the coast and woodlands.

data.title: beach
data.text: This park is my go to place in the summer I have been going here on and off for years always took my kids here and now my grandkids they have a park area and a bike path also the beach and picnic area

data.title: Walking and Bike trail in Warwick
data.text: You don't need to drive to Narragansett or Newport for water views! Nice walking path almost 3 miles. Can also bike on it! Sit at beach pretty nice in Warwick!

data.title: A not very nicely kept park
data.text: Went to sit by the water, and while the park could be lovely, it needs some serious upkeep.  The beach area was dingy, with broken playground equipment, not well tended picnic areas, and weeds throughout.  Restrooms were closed (although you would probably not want to use them) with a port o potty outside them.

data.title: get healthy use the park to walk and jog.
data.text: when you think park think walking paths,sports fields,running trails and all the nice things in this very clean and well taken care of park in the center of Warwick,RI. you will enjoy it as will the kids.

data.title: Dog park disgusting.
data.text: Warwick City Park is a great place to walk, but the dog park is a disgusting mess! It's completely dirt, no water is provided and the city has stopped providing dog waste bags so people just don't bother cleaning up after their dogs. I will not bring my dog there.

data.title: Great place for many activities
data.text: The Warwick City Park is the best kept secret. There are many trails for walking or bicycling. Great place to walk your dog on the trails. OR you can take your dog to the dog park which is inside the grounds. There are two areas for your dog to play and run safely. There is an enclosed area for big dogs and one for small dogs. Large areas for your dog to walk, run and play. There's also a lovely small beach which is part of the City Park. A lovely little beach, with a picnic area. Great place to watch JULY fireworks as well! In the City Park are also empty fields. An area specifically for field hockey, basketball courts and baseball field. A great find!

data.title: Great if you need to stay local
data.text: The park is small, clean. Might be difficult to get to if you aren't from the area and don't have GPS. The beach water is often closed due to high bacteria levels, but you can still sun in the sand! There is a decent small playground for the kids as well.

data.title: walking path
data.text: Warwick city park has a walking path, I believe it is 2.9 miles.  It is different from the bike path in that it is only a "one way " walking /riding path. you are supposed to walk in a clockwise direction which is great if you want to walk the whole path, but if you don't want to walk the almost 3 miles you'll have to turn around and be walking in essence, the wrong way. It is very wooded and hidden from the road which means safety can be a concern.In fact several years ago a man was murdered there, you will see a memorial along the path . The park has a dog park, a small playground, baseball and soccer fields and a small beach .

data.title: A hidden gem
data.text: Acres of space with walking trails, ball parks, dog park, picnic areas and of course the beach. Clean and safe.
